title: Type ID - Please Help
content:
Looking for Id's for the 3 fonts in the image. I apologize for the low resolution. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Typeid.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100331125058/http:/typophile.com/files/Typeid.jpg) | 152.76 KB |
author: one8e

comments.content:
The script is [Mea Culpa](http://web.archive.org/web/20100331125058/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typesetit/mea-culpa/), by Rob Leuschke.

That text sample is totally un-readable, and so blurry that I don't see how anyone could ID it.

- Mike Yanega

The N might be Adobe Garamond (or a lot of other things, frankly). How would most people be able to tell, even if you didn't pick the exact font? Sometimes there is little point in being so precise. Or is there something special about this N as you see it?

- Mike Yanega
Well, Mike, at least you can see the image, my browser won't even display it:)

OK, I looked for an N with a slight curve to the legs and I think this may be [Californian](http://web.archive.org/web/20100331125058/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-californian/) (a.k.a. Berkeley Old Style). Goudy was famous for having odd details in his typefaces, partly because he cut his own masters.

- Mike Yanega

Here is a re-sized gif version of the posted image.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100331125058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NAdreinne_3693.gif)
